steps.title: Group Sidebar
steps.text: This is Lyra's visual sidebar. Here you'll find guides, marks and scales corresponding to the visualization enumerated into groups.

steps.title: Inspector Sidebar
steps.text: The Inspector Sidebar allows you to modify different attributes of the current visualization such as a mark's fill color or the number of ticks  present in a specific axis

steps.title: Pipeline Sidebar
steps.text: This sidebar will be populated with data tables once you've imported data.

steps.title: Marks - Toolbar
steps.text: Marks are the primary elements of a visualization: they are graphical primitives whose properties (such as position, size, shape, and color) can be used to visually encode data. To add marks to the visualization, you can select them from this Toolbar

steps.title: Export
steps.text: The Export button allows you to download the visualizations created by Lyra in PNG, SVG, JSON or HTML formats.

steps.title: Importing Data
steps.text: All data used in Lyra is loading via a Pipeline Modal which can be accessed by clicking this '+ NEW' button.
instructions: Click '+ NEW' to open the Pipeline Modal

steps.title: Examples
steps.text: You can import data in Lyra from example datasets.

steps.title: Urls
steps.text: You can laod data from external urls.

steps.title: Drag and Drop / Raw Input
steps.text: You can enter raw data or drag and drop files with appropriate formatting in this dropzone.

steps.title: Loading Data
steps.text: Let's import some data! Choose one of the various import methods and load any dataset of your chosing.
instructions: Choose one of the various import methods and load any dataset of your chosing
Once you've done so, an 'import' button pictured below will appear in addition to a preview table
Click 'import' to make this data available for usage in Lyra

steps.title: Woo Hoo!
steps.text: You've now been acquainted with Lyra's interface!
